title.narrative: Business Case for Electric Vehicle Dissemination in Vientiane, Lao PDR

description.narrative: The project team will work towards the components of i.) Business case development based on detailed assessment of technical/economic/financial/ environmental/social feasibility of EV dissemination ii.) Policy and regulatory gap analysis and recommendations iii.) Design of a financial mechanism - EV lending/subsidy program, GCF, carbon finance, etc. iv.) Identification of potential private and public funding sources v.) Development of Information, Education, and Communication (IEC) Strategies.

The project team will work towards the components of i.) Business case development based on detailed assessment of technical/economic/financial/ environmental/social feasibility of EV dissemination ii.) Policy and regulatory gap analysis and recommendations iii.) Design of a financial mechanism - EV lending/subsidy program, GCF, carbon finance, etc. iv.) Identification of potential private and public funding sources v.) Development of Information, Education, and Communication (IEC) Strategies.

participating-org.narrative: Department of Transport under Ministry of Public Works and Transport

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04535 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: Access to clean affordable EVs increased among people in Lao PDR, especially low income groups.

description.narrative: Access to clean affordable energy by increased sales of Evs

Air quality improved through reduction in GHG emissions from increased use of EVs in Lao PDR.

description.narrative: GHG emission reduced by switching gasoline powered vehicles to EVs using electricity generated from hydropower (based on statistics on EV sales volume/auto loans provided)

title.narrative: GHG emissions reduction from business as usual (MtCO2e)

Technical advice on policy, technical standards, and financing strategies to create enabling environment for EV deployment in Lao PDR

title.narrative: Report on financing strategies for EVs
Report on policy recommendations & technical standards
Increased use of EV (2Ws/4Ws) in Lao PDR through favorable policy environment, improved financing conditions for consumers, and enhanced public awareness on EVs.
